text: I applaud the President and the administration’s hard-won efforts in facilitating these historic peace agreements with both the United Arab Emirates and Bahrain which advance the cause of peace and prosperity in the region.

The normalization of relations between the UAE and Israel will advance commerce, encourage travel between the two countries, and establish diplomatic ties – and help encourage mutual economic, diplomatic, and security goals.
Forging new partnerships between our friends in the Middle East is critical to countering the region’s malign actors such as Iran and is in the best interest of U.S. national security.

Introduced John Hartwell, @USUAggies Athletic Director, at @GOPHELP today. His experience at USU and as a former student athlete is helpful as we examine the potential impacts of the @NCAA’s decision to allow athletes to be compensated for the use of their name, image & likeness. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh91M6bWAAAZD82.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1305890417750290432/vid/480x270/R3_4BbBQJi_D2US_.mp4?tag=13

RT @GovHerbert I enjoyed seeing the unveiling of Dr. Martha Hughes Cannon’s statue today. Martha shattered boundaries and paved the way for women in Utah. I’m grateful for the talented and accomplished female leaders we have in our state, both then and now. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh5szHAVoAAySzS.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh5szHOU0AApgHT.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh5szHcVoAAAU2_.jpg

RT @utahsenate “Martha Hughes Cannon can be held up as an allegory to inspire others who face barriers, discrimination, injustice, uphill battles and seemingly lost causes. Martha knew how to overcome and we can learn from and be inspired by her." @DeidreHenderson #utpol http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh5tHe5VkAAXpGI.jpg
The climate crisis is an existential threat and a fundamental challenge of our time. RT if you agree.

Josiah Williams was 16.
Wyatt Tofte was found in a car with his dog. He was 13.
A one-year-old boy died after fleeing a fire with his parents.

My heart grieves for the families and communities that have been torn apart by this devastating wildfire season. https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/salvadorhernandez/wildfire-deaths-california-oregon-washington
The historic wildfire season in the West and record-breaking hurricane season in the Atlantic are not a coincidence. This is climate change.

Hispanic Heritage Month is time to reflect on the incredible beauty of our Hispanic communities and the immense strength they bring to our nation. It’s also a reminder that the strength of our union is found in our diversity and our unity.

Never forget that.

These horrific allegations and long-standing mistreatment at detention centers are why immigrants should not be unnecessarily detained during a pandemic. Congress should pass my FIRST Act to ensure immigrants are protected.
https://www.booker.senate.gov/news/press/sen-booker-and-rep-jayapal-unveil-bold-legislation-to-move-immigrants-out-of-detention-and-halt-immigration-enforcement-during-coronavirus-emergency

The whistleblower complaint detailing heinous abuses to immigrant detainees under ICE custody—including subjecting female detainees to hysterectomies at alarming rates, medical neglect & more—must be investigated. I’ve written to @DHSOIG to find answers. https://www.booker.senate.gov/news/press/sen-booker-demands-ig-investigation-into-horrific-mistreatment-of-immigrant-detainees-alleged-by-whistleblower

Today kicks off #HHM celebrating Latinx, Latino & Hispanic Americans’ rich heritage & contributions to our nation. The Latino community faces many challenges—from being disproportionately harmed by #COVID19 & climate change to heartless immigration policies—we must keep fighting.

RT @theappeal Many states have already taken steps to legalize marijuana. What will it take to finally get the federal government to do the same? Today on #TheBriefing, Sen. @CoryBooker and Reps. @AyannaPressley and @repblumenauer join to discuss, live at 12:15 ET/9:15 PT. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh92MFUUMAAj7KS.jpg

This is horrific. There must be an immediate investigation into these disturbing allegations of human rights abuse. https://twitter.com/CNN/status/1305882840379412480 QT @CNN A whistleblower who previously worked at an Immigration and Customs Enforcement facility in Georgia detailed a high rate of hysterectomies and alleged medical neglect in a complaint filed to the Department of Homeland Security inspector general https://trib.al/ryahnRF

Today’s ceremony marks a critical milestone in America’s effort to advance peace in the region and counter Iran, and I look forward to working with the Trump administration and our allies to build upon these agreements, strengthen our allies, and develop deeper diplomatic ties. https://twitter.com/StateDept/status/1305930176031670272 QT @StateDept President @realDonaldTrump, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, Foreign Minister Abdullah bin Zayed Al Nahyan of the UAE, and Foreign Minister Abdullatif bin Rashid Al Zayani of Bahrain sign the Abraham Accords. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1305930112211222531/pu/img/_vmunoPZrONYw1D5.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1305930112211222531/pu/vid/480x270/_ashUUiH7cCzjIgf.mp4?tag=10

I applaud @avucic's move to designate Hezbollah a terror group. Hezbollah’s an Iran-controlled terrorist organization responsible for killing hundreds of Americans, I’m grateful for Serbia’s leadership in taking steps to minimize Hezbollah’s ability to operate in Europe. https://twitter.com/Jerusalem_Post/status/1305172175691841536 QT @Jerusalem_Post #BREAKING: #Serbia reportedly designated #Hezbollah as a terrorist organization. https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/serbia-designates-hezbollah-as-terrorist-organization-report-642126

RT @cbs11jack #NEW @SenTedCruz praises peace deal b/w Israel, United Arab Emirates & Bahrain:“Advancing the cause of peace is best achieved by standing unshakably with our friends and allies & the Trump administration deserves enormous credit for bringing them together diplomatically.” @CBSDFW

This afternoon I attended the ceremony for the signing of the Abraham Accords at the @WhiteHouse. This historic agreement will normalize relations between Israel, the UAE & Bahrain. 
 
Read my statement on this effort to advance the cause of peace in the Middle East region here👇

I’ve long said that advancing the cause of peace is best achieved by standing unshakably with our friends and allies, and the Trump administration deserves enormous credit for bringing them together diplomatically. https://www.wsj.com/articles/peace-shalom-salaam-11600127046

RT @USArmsControl .@PantexPlant is home to many of our best and brightest. Consummate professionals within our nuclear weapons complex. We appreciate the opportunity to see America’s unsurpassable capabilities up close. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EhpxsiKVoAIr8Uf.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EhpxsiLUwAE-9BA.jpg

Glad to see @LGHNNSA & @USArmsControl tour Texas’ @PantexPlant last week, including innovative new defense technologies being developed at Pantex that are necessary for ensuring America’s nuclear primacy and nuclear security. https://twitter.com/USArmsControl/status/1304148827780403201 QT @USArmsControl .@SenTedCruz @JohnCornyn @MacTXPress @GregAbbott_TX and the great state of #Texas are rightly proud of the impressive team @PantexPlant. 
Pantex is booming. Busiest it’s been in two decades—we are rapidly modernizing our nation’s deterrent. #PeaceThroughStrength https://twitter.com/lghnnsa/status/1304115227915702273

I’ve spent years fighting @usedgov to protect students scammed by for-profit colleges. I’m very glad that @MassAGO Healey & our country’s AGs are helping these cheated ITT Tech students get the private student loan cancellation they deserve. https://www.bostonglobe.com/2020/09/15/business/56m-debt-erased-former-mass-itt-tech-students/

COVID-19 has made it impossible to ignore how structural racism creates deep public health disparities in Black and Brown communities. Congress should pass my bill with @RepPressley & @RepBarbaraLee to start attacking structural racism at its roots. https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2020/09/15/racism-public-health-crisis/

Another day, another Congressional hearing that proves what we all know: Google uses its ginormous size to snuff out competitors and exercise its power over our economy and democracy. It's long past time for @TheJusticeDept to #BreakUpBigTech. https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/09/15/google-antitrust-senate-hearing/

Reports that an @ICEgov detention center is performing mass hysterectomies on immigrants are horrifying. Congress must hold hearings now to investigate these possible human rights violations & the long line of medical abuse & neglect at these facilities. https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/93578d/staggering-number-of-hysterectomies-happening-at-ice-facility-whistleblower-say

RT @SenDougJones 57 years ago, four innocent little girls were killed by a bomb planted outside the 16th Street Baptist Church in Birmingham. Today, we can honor the memories of Addie Mae, Carol, Cynthia & Denise by uniting against the forces stoking the flames of hatred & division. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh93Jk5WsAMwaQn.jpg

This fight isn't over. The ruling can & will be appealed. But Congress must act. The House passed the American Dream & Promise Act over a year ago. The Senate must do the same. We must protect TPS holders & their families from the Trump admin’s racist & anti-immigrant agenda.

I’m deeply disappointed by the 9th Circuit decision to end TPS for over 300,000 immigrants. These families are part of the fabric of our communities & economy. Many have been our essential workers during this pandemic. Ending protections for them now is just plain cruel. https://twitter.com/nprpolitics/status/1305887868670349312 QT @nprpolitics A federal appeals court panel said the Trump administration can end humanitarian protections for some 300,000 immigrants living in the U.S. — many of whom have lived in the U.S. for decades — paving the way for potential deportations starting next year. https://www.npr.org/2020/09/14/912900167/court-rules-government-can-end-humanitarian-protections-for-some-300-000-immigra?utm_campaign=politics&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_term=nprnews&utm_medium=social

We need to transform our punitive system of locking people up into one that invests in community services that lift people up. I talked to @Cosmopolitan about rethinking our criminal justice system from top to bottom and rooting out systemic racism in every part of our society: https://twitter.com/Cosmopolitan/status/1305887384811249664 QT @Cosmopolitan The Police System is Broken. These 10+ Women Have the Answer(s) to How to (Maybe, Possibly) Fix It https://www.cosmopolitan.com/politics/a33807010/police-reform-women/?utm_campaign=socialflowTWCOS&utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social-media&src=socialflowTW

We need a president who believes in science. This endorsement may be unprecedented, but the choice couldn't be more clear. https://twitter.com/sciam/status/1305854127721910275 QT @sciam Scientific American has never endorsed a presidential candidate in our 175-year history—until now. 

The 2020 election is literally a matter of life and death. We urge you to vote for health, science and Joe Biden for President.
https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/scientific-american-endorses-joe-biden/

We’ve built an action center to tackle these issues head-on—from holding individual companies accountable, to demanding workplace safety, to calling Congress about essential workers and corporate mergers. Take action to stand with workers now:

https://elizabethwarren.com/action/corporate-accountability?source=soc-WB-ew-tw-091420

Millions of workers have lost their lives or livelihoods during this pandemic, and many more are still putting their lives on the line every day with too few protections. Meanwhile, some giant corporations are getting bailed out by taxpayers, and others are seeing record profits.

Latinx and Hispanic Americans have been on the front lines of nearly every movement to transform our country for the better. Yet they’ve been attacked by the Trump administration from the start. This #LatinxHeritageMonth, it's more critical than ever to stand up and fight back.

I’m excited to endorse @ElectAdamGomez for the Massachusetts State Senate. During this crisis, working families need real leadership in Boston, and that’s what Adam will bring. I’m proud to stand shoulder to shoulder with him in this fight. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh9cNjtWkAAPTav.jpg

I'm thrilled to endorse @KhimVanna for State Representative. She will bring a unique voice to the State House—a much needed perspective that will reflect the diverse community she will serve. I look forward to supporting her now through Election Day. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh9bx-6XkAEOT8r.jpg

.@AmyKennedy715 is a tireless fighter for change and a true leader with compassion and integrity. Amy is running to fight for working people in New Jersey’s 2nd Congressional District, for access to affordable health care, and for an economy that works for all. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh9bNWjWAAMLacL.jpg

As an engineer and an entrepreneur, @DonnaImamTX’s expertise will be indispensable in Congress during this time of crisis. She'll fight for working Americans and to hold billionaires accountable. I’m proud to stand shoulder to shoulder with her in the fight to flip Texas Blue. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh9a0_SX0AEflC1.jpg

I am confident that @NikemaWilliams will follow the footsteps of Congressman John Lewis and continue to uplift the voices of the people of Georgia’s 5th Congressional District. She’s a fearless leader and advocate for her community, I’m excited to see her at work in Congress. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh9aX0aX0AQftCD.jpg

The people of Tennessee deserve a leader who believes in science, facts, decency, and the urgent need to advance racial justice. @Bradshaw2020 is that leader, and I'll be standing alongside her in this fight and the many fights to come. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh9Z6LWXYAA1Dor.jpg

I’m excited to endorse @Hiral4Congress in her run to represent Arizona’s 6th congressional district. I know she'll be a welcome addition to a coalition of bold and courageous leaders who are working to root out the corruption in Washington. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh9ZalbWkAEGBMo.jpg

.@AbbyBroyles and I have quite a bit in common: We're Oklahoma women who put ourselves through law school and have spent our careers fighting for transparency. I’m proud to endorse Abby because I know she’ll show up for all Oklahomans. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh9ZBTJWoAENxXq.jpg

.@TwinaForSenate is an experienced community leader and fighter for big, structural change who knows what working families need to get ahead. I know she’ll continue to fight for equity and justice in Washington’s State Senate. That’s why I’m supporting her campaign. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh9YUJrXYAAgnx_.jpg

.@PerkinsForLA knows firsthand how to lead in times of crisis, and he's ready to put people before politics. The people of Louisiana deserve a senator like Adrian—and I'm proud to stand alongside him in the fight to make this country work for everyone. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh9Xl9DXYAMINhe.jpg

With 49 days to go, we need to do everything we can to help elect leaders across the country and up and down the ballot that are ready to fight for bold reforms and put people first. Take a look at my latest slate of endorsements and join us in the fight: http://ewar.ren/Endorsements_ http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh9XTKTWkAIJnVC.jpg

We can no longer tolerate a system that allows a billionaire like Elon Musk to gain $10.3 billion in one day, while 30 million unemployed workers are denied $600 a week to pay the rent and put food on the table. We need an economy that works for all, not just the 1%. #TaxTheRich

RT @toseeeachother Listen in to a new podcast series by @PplsAction, @ToSeeEachOther. They travel through rural and small town America, where people are coming together, against the odds, #toseeeachother. Subscribe. /to-see-each-other/  /to-see-each-other/
RT @PplsAction We are working to create a democracy that cares. If you believe that we can, join TONIGHT's town hall and learn how you can help us #DefeatTrumpHealAmerica.  https://ppls.ac/town-hall

At a time of unprecedented economic pain and suffering the do-nothing Senate must pass:

- $600 a week for the unemployed
- $2,000 a month for the working class
- An emergency expansion of Medicare to all
- Hazard pay for essential workers
- $25 billion for the Postal Service

In the midst of a global pandemic and a climate crisis, we cannot continue having a president who rejects science. We have 49 days to go before Election Day. Let us defeat Trump, elect progressives and reverse the incredible damage that has been done to our nation.

These reports are simply horrifying. They must be investigated by Congress and anyone responsible must be held accountable for these disturbing acts. We must dismantle ICE and CBP and create an immigration system based on justice, not cruelty and human rights violations. https://twitter.com/brooklynmarie/status/1305553553625243648 QT @brooklynmarie Whistleblower: There Were Mass Hysterectomies at ICE Facility | Law & Crime https://lawandcrime.com/high-profile/like-an-experimental-concentration-camp-whistleblower-complaint-alleges-mass-hysterectomies-at-ice-detention-center/

RT @TexasTribune NEW: ICE deported a crucial witness in an ongoing investigation into allegations of sexual assault and harassment at an El Paso immigrant detention center, according to the witness' lawyers. 

With @ProPublica: https://www.texastribune.org/2020/09/15/ice-deport-witness-sexual-assault/?utm_campaign=trib-social&utm_content=1600194817&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter

It’s astounding that after a massive family separation operation, mass sexual assault of detainees, trapping immigrants in COVID-infected detention centers, and now reports of mass hysterectomies (which the US has done before), abolishing ICE is controversial.

Where’s the line?

RT @RepBarbaraLee 19 years ago today, I cast my lone vote against endless war.
